input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Measles complicated by meningitis

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE A 7-YEAR-OLD BOY
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Fever, which has reached as high as 105°F (40.6°C)
- Dry cough and runny nose
- Red, watering eyes (conjunctivitis)
- Koplik spots inside your mouth
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
My mom said I started feeling really hot and sweaty yesterday, and I couldn’t stop coughing. I also noticed my eyes were super red and watery, and I saw tiny white spots inside my mouth today. I’ve been feeling pretty tired and irritable, and my nose has been running all the time. I live in a dorm where lots of kids are sick, and I haven't been vaccinated against measles fully. It all came on pretty suddenly, and I feel worse now because my head hurts and I feel dizzy.
output:
THINKING: The boy is very young, and he's clearly uncomfortable with all of these symptoms. He seems overwhelmed and a little scared. I should keep my questions simple and gentle to help him feel safe while get
ANSWER: I guess I feel really terrible. My head and my nose and everything just hurt so much, and I keep feeling super hot and sweaty. I don’t really know what’s wrong, but I feel really sick.
thinking: The boy is very young, and he's clearly uncomfortable with all of these symptoms. He seems overwhelmed and a little scared. I should keep my questions simple and gentle to help him feel safe while get
answer: I guess I feel really terrible. My head and my nose and everything just hurt so much, and I keep feeling super hot and sweaty. I don’t really know what’s wrong, but I feel really sick.
